QuestItem_OsirisScrip.name: Osiris Scrip
QuestItem_OsirisScrip.description: Rewarded by Osiris, required for upgrades to your Quarters' K-Mark and Aurum generators.

QuestItem_HardDrive_DigSite.name: Dig Site Data Drive
QuestItem_HardDrive_DigSite.description: A data drive carrying information on the Bright Sands Dig Site.

QuestItem_HardDrive_Tier5.description: A data drive with highly valuable and unique information. Can be exchanged for K-Marks.
QuestItem_HardDrive_Tier5.name: Data Drive Tier 5

QuestItem_HardDrive_Tier3.description: A data drive with rare information. Data can be improved at an Uplink, or the drive exchanged for K-Marks.
QuestItem_HardDrive_Tier3.name: Data Drive Tier 3

QuestItem_HardDrive_Tier2.description: A data drive with some interesting information. Data can be improved at an Uplink, or the drive exchanged for K-Marks.
QuestItem_HardDrive_Tier2.name: Data Drive Tier 2

QuestItem_HardDrive_Tier4.description: A data drive with valuable information. Data can be improved at an Uplink, or the drive exchanged for K-Marks.
QuestItem_HardDrive_Tier4.name: Data Drive Tier 4

QuestItem_HardDrive_Tier1.description: A data drive. Data can be improved at an Uplink, or the drive exchanged for K-Marks.

WinterMaterial_Event_01.description:
A jolly little spaceman figurine, themed after the suits used by the crew of the Starlight Song as they assisted in the rescue of Aurora Station over the planet Neptune in 2125.

Models like this would often sing short and happy songs, light up, or even dance around.
WinterMaterial_Event_01.name: Singing Spaceman

QuestItem_Battery.description: A letium-based battery that can be used to power various machinery on Fortuna.
QuestItem_Battery.name: Battery

QuestItem_LaserDrillBeacon.description: A powerful locator that can be used to call down a Korolev Laser Drill Platform on Extreme Letium Veins.
QuestItem_LaserDrillBeacon.name: Laser Drill Beacon

QuestItem_OilPumpBeacon.description: A powerful locator that can be used to call down an ICA NiC pump and refiner on an oil deposit.
QuestItem_OilPumpBeacon.name: Oil Pump Beacon

QuestItem_AlphaWardenBait.name: Alpha Crusher Bait
QuestItem_AlphaWardenBait.description: Printed using Mutated Biomass, this bait can be used to summon an Alpha Crusher at one of its Feeding Grounds.

MS_Onboarding_Intro_PlayerQuarters_07.name: Access the Delivery Station in your Quarters

MS_Onboarding_Intro_FirstMatch_01.name: Access the Launch Terminal and deploy to Fortuna III

MS_Onboarding_Intro_02_Message.name: All that free new gear won't help you if you don't equip it. Open your Inventory to check what you have.

MS_TutorialStep_Desc_Evac02.name: Call in your <B1>evac ship</> (Press <inputAction light=true name=CallEvac/>)

MS_TutorialStep_Desc_Welcome.name:
Catch your bearings - <B1>Gather loot</>, <B1>hunt creatures</> and try to <B1>survive</> this training simulation!

Completing your <B1>Missions</> (Press <inputAction light=true name=ShowContractsInHud/>) is optional.

MS_Onboarding_Intro_FirstMatch_04.name: Complete a Mission! You might need to use a mineral scanner. Check your Map (<inputAction light=true name=ToggleMap/>) and Mission Info (<inputAction light=true name=ShowContractsInHud/>) for details.

MS_Onboarding_Intro_PlayerQuarters_06.name: Construct the first Supply Crate Upgrade

MS_Onboarding_Intro_OpenStash_08.name: Drag a Basic Mineral Scanner into your backpack

MS_Onboarding_Intro_OpenStash_02.name: Drag a backpack into the backpack slot

MS_Onboarding_Intro_OpenStash_05.name: Drag a consumable into your backpack

MS_Onboarding_Intro_OpenStash_07.name: Drag a helmet into the helmet Slot

MS_Onboarding_Intro_OpenStash_06.name: Drag a shield into the Shield Slot

MS_Onboarding_Intro_OpenStash_03.name: Drag a weapon into a weapon slot

MS_Onboarding_Intro_OpenStash_04.name: Drag ammo for your weapon into your backpack

MS_TutorialStep_Desc_HealthStim01.name: Equip your <B1>Combat Stim</> (Hold <inputAction light=true name=ConsumableWheel/>) then use it (<inputAction light=true name=Fire/>) to heal yourself

MS_TutorialStep_Desc_Mine01.name: Equip your <B1>pickaxe</> (Hold <inputAction light=true name=ToolWheel/>) to mine <B1>minerals</>

MS_TutorialStep_Desc_Scan01.name: Equip your <B1>scanner</> (Hold <inputAction light=true name=ToolWheel/>) to search for <B1>minerals</>

MS_Onboarding_Intro_FirstMatch_05.name: Find an Evac location and get off the planet - the ship can take some time to arrive!

MS_TutorialQuest_01_StepTitle.name:
Find your <B1>Evac</> Location, call down a Ship and evacuate to complete the simulation. 

Completing your <B1>Mission</> (Press <inputAction light=true name=ShowContractsInHud/>) is optional.

MS_Onboarding_FeatureBlocked_Contracts_B.name: Finish Badum's tasks to unlock this feature.

MS_Onboarding_FeatureBlocked_CraftingSta.name: Finish Badum's tasks to unlock this feature.

MS_Onboarding_FeatureBlocked_Generators_.name: Finish Badum's tasks to unlock this feature.

MS_Onboarding_FeatureBlocked_PlayMatch_B.name: Finish Badum's tasks to unlock this feature.

MS_Onboarding_FeatureBlocked_Techtree_Bo.name: Finish Badum's tasks to unlock this feature.

MS_Onboarding_FeatureBlocked_WeaponPurch.name: Finish Badum's tasks to unlock this feature.

MS_TutorialQuest_02_StepTitle.name: Get inside the ship before it leaves to evacuate!

MS_Onboarding_Intro_MakingALiving_01.name: Go to any of the Faction leaders to get one or more Missions

MS_Onboarding_Intro_Crafting_02.name: Go to the Public Gear Printer

MS_Onboarding_Intro_FirstMatch_06.name: Go to the faction HQ and complete your Mission

MS_Onboarding_Intro_04_Subject.name: Go to the three Faction leaders and accept a mission from each

MS_Onboarding_Intro_PlayerQuarters_02.name: Go to your new Prospector Quarters

MS_TutorialStep_Desc_Evac04.name: Head into the <B1>evac ship</> before it departs

MS_Onboarding_Intro_FactionShop_03.name:
Here you can sell items from your stash to gain K-Marks and Faction Reputation.

Remember, no refunds! Don't sell anything you might need!

MS_Onboarding_Intro_FirstMatch_03.name: Hold <inputAction light=true name=PushToTalk/> to enable <B1>Push To Talk</> if you are using a microphone.

MS_Onboarding_Intro_FirstMatch_02.name: Hold <inputAction light=true name=Social/>) to open your <B1>Communication Wheel</>. This enables you to communicate with nearby prospectors. Try selecting an option now.

MS_Onboarding_Intro_03_Message.name: OK, you're all set. Head to the Launch Terminal. From there you can start your first drop onto Fortuna III.

MS_TutorialStep_Desc_Inventory01.name: Open your inventory(Press <inputAction light=true name=OpenMatchInventory/>). Then drag an item into your <B1>Safe Pockets</>.

MS_Onboarding_Intro_OpenStash_01.name: Press <inputAction light=true name=OpenMatchInventory/> to open the <B1>inventory</>

MS_TutorialStep_Desc_Map01.name: Press <inputAction light=true name=ToggleMap/> to open your <B1>map</> and look for your <B1>evac</> location

MS_Onboarding_Intro_02_Subject.name: Press <inputAction light=true name=OpenMatchInventory/> and access your <B1>Inventory</>

MS_Onboarding_Intro_Crafting_01.name: Return to Badum at the bar

MS_Onboarding_Intro_PlayerQuarters_01.name: Return to Badum at the bar

MS_TutorialStep_Title_Loot.name: Search the area for anything useful

MS_Onboarding_Intro_01_Message.name:
So, you want to be a prospector?

Well first thing's first, head to any one of the three faction HQs and pick up a Contract; that'll get your name on the work roster and give you your first task on the surface. Don't worry about which faction you start with, you can take work from any of them at any time later on.

Come back when you've got a Contract, I'll get you started with some spare gear.

MS_Onboarding_Intro_TalkToBadum_02.name: Speak with all three Faction leaders and accept their missions

MS_Onboarding_Intro_TalkToBadum_03.name: Talk to Badum and claim your welcome package

MS_Onboarding_Intro_01_Subject.name: Talk to Badum at The Lucky Leafman Bar

MS_Onboarding_Intro_TalkToBadum_01.name: Talk to Badum at The Lucky Leafman Bar

MS_TutorialStep_Desc_Mine02.name: Use your <B1>pickaxe</> (Press <inputAction light=true name=Fire/>) to mine for <B1>minerals</>

MS_TutorialStep_Desc_Scan02.name: Use your <B1>scanner</> (Press <inputAction light=true name=Fire/>) to search for <B1>minerals</>

MS_Onboarding_Intro_Crafting_05.name: Wait for printing to be complete, or skip the timer for the Medium Backpack at the Public Gear Printer.

MS_TutorialStep_Desc_Evac03.name:
Wait for your <B1>evac ship</> to arrive. 

<B1>Warning!</> - Evac ship will crush anything beneath it when landing!

MS_Onboarding_NpcText_BadumGenericDialog.name:
What's up?

You should be all set now; check with the factions if you need work, and don't forget to upgrade your Quarters when you can, it'll make your life up here far easier.

MS_Onboarding_Intro_04_Message.name:
You made it back in one piece! Never expected less, of course.

Next up, you should check the different factions' contract boards, those guys could use somebody like you. And don't forget to turn your loot into money at the faction vendors!

MS_TutorialStep_Desc_Evac05.name: You missed the <B1>evac ship</>! Call it again to head off the planet

MS_Onboarding_Intro_PlayerQuarters_09.name: Your Delivery Station
MS_Onboarding_Intro_PlayerQuarters_09.description: Your Delivery Station will also contain any Twitch Drops your entitled to, Welcome Packs purchased in past seasons, and other unique deliveries meant for you.

Description_FullscreenMode.name:
<BH1>Fullscreen:</> Dedicated fullscreen mode
<BH1>Windowed Fullscreen:</> Best of both worlds
<BH1>Windowed:</> Classic application window

Description_DLSS.name:
<BH1>Off:</> Disabled
<BH1>Auto:</> Automatically chosen input resolution
<BH1>Ultra Quality:</> 77% input resolution
<BH1>Quality:</> 66.6% input resolution
<BH1>Balanced:</> 58% input resolution
<BH1>Performance:</> 50% input resolution
<BH1>Ultra Performance:</> 33.3% input resolution

Description_FSR.name:
<BH1>Off:</> Disabled
<BH1>Ultra Quality:</> 77% input resolution
<BH1>Quality:</> 67% input resolution
<BH1>Balanced:</> 59% input resolution
<BH1>Performance:</> 50% input resolution
<BH1>Ultra Quality (Hybrid):</> 77% input resolution, with additional Temporal upscaling
<BH1>Quality (Hybrid):</> 67% input resolution, with additional Temporal upscaling
<BH1>Balanced (Hybrid):</> 59% input resolution, with additional Temporal upscaling
<BH1>Performance (Hybrid):</> 50% input resolution, with additional Temporal upscaling

Description_EnableMotionBlur.name: Adds a sense of motion by blurring the surrounding environment when looking around. Does not apply when using Low Post Process Quality settings.

Description_MicrophoneSensitivity.name: Adjust the input sensitivity for when the microphone should broadcast if push to talk is disabled.

Description_MasterVolume.name: Adjust the overall volume of the game.

Description_OutputVolume.name: Adjust the voice output volume from other players.

Description_DrawDistance.name: Adjusts at which distance specific assets will be made visible.

Description_HitmarkerVolume.name: Adjusts the hit marker volume when hitting a target.

Description_MusicVolume.name: Adjusts the music volume of the game.

Description_FoliageQuality.name: Adjusts the quality of the foliage.

Description_UIScale.name: Adjusts the size of all interface elements either larger or smaller.

Description_SoundEffectsVolume.name: Adjusts the sound effects volume of the game.

Description_TextureQuality.name: Adjusts the texture quality of surfaces making them appear more or less sharp.

Description_ShadowQuality.name: Adjusts the visual quality of shadows and the detail.

Description_DialogueVolume.name: Adjusts the volume of Comm Wheel chatter and NPC dialogue.

Description_FieldOfViewMovementChanges.name: Allow for field of view changes based on the movement states. This might sell the effect that you sprint faster.

Description_CrouchToggle.name: Allows for crouch to be either on  toggle or hold.

Description_LeaningToggle.name: Allows for leaning to be either on toggle or hold.

Description_MaxFPS.name: Allows for locking to a set FPS to minimalize fluctuation offering a more consistent experience.

Description_SprintToggle.name: Allows for sprint to be either on  toggle or hold.

Description_TargetingToggle.name: Allows for targeting to be either on toggle or hold.

Description_EnableMultiThreadedRendering.name: Allows for the game to use an additional thread which can improve the performance if the CPU allows.

Description_ChatEnabled.name: Always show the chat widget on screen when someone chats.

Description_AutoDetect.name: Auto detect the best video settings or allows for further customization.

Description_FOVBasedSensitivityScaling.name:
Automatically scales mouse sensitivity relative to the current weapon / optic FOV.
This ensures that the same amount of mouse movement is required to move the camera for the same amount on screen, independently of weapon / optic FOV.

Description_Language.name: Change the in game text to another language.

Description_Resolution.name: Change the resolution size when display mode is set to fullscreen or windowed, not for fullscreen windowed.

Description_FOV.name: Changing the field of view allows for showing more of the surrounding area but making the center area appear further away.

Description_Gamma.name: Controls the brightness of the game. Adjust until the top Leafman is barely visible.

Description_MuteOutputAudio.name: Disables any incoming audio from other players.

Description_MuteInputAudio.name: Disables any input audio that would be broadcasted to other players.

Description_EnableHighlights.name: Enable or disable the automatic capture of key moments during gameplay, via Nvidia Shadowplay Highlights.

Description_ChatEnabledBrazilian.name: Enables access to the Brazilian and Portuguese channel in text chat.

Description_ChatEnabledChinese.name: Enables access to the Chinese channel in text chat.

Description_ChatEnabledEnglish.name: Enables access to the English channel in text chat.

Description_ChatEnabledFrench.name: Enables access to the French channel in text chat.

Description_ChatEnabledGerman.name: Enables access to the German channel in text chat.

Description_ChatEnabledPolish.name: Enables access to the Polish channel in text chat.

Description_ChatEnabledRussian.name: Enables access to the Russian channel in text chat.

Description_ChatEnabledSpanish.name: Enables access to the Spanish channel in text chat.

Description_ChatEnabledTurkish.name: Enables access to the Turkish channel in text chat.

Description_BinauralAudio.name: Enables binaural audio for audio spatialization.

Description_EnablePerScopeSensitivity.name: Enables further individual adjustments based on the variety of in-game optic magnifications.

Description_ImageSharpening.name: Enhances the overall sharpness of the game.

Description_RenderingDeviceAdapter.name: Forces selection of the rendering adapter to be used once the game restarts. Don't change this unless you are having issues.

Description_VSync.name: Locks the frame rate based on the monitors refresh rate to eliminate screen tearing.

Description_RotateMinimap.name: Rotation of the mini map based on the direction the player is facing.

Description_EnableDX12.name:
Runs the game with DX12. On newer hardware this can result in improved rendering performance.
Requires a game restart.
NOTE: This feature is experimental.

Description_ResolutionQuality.name: Scales the internal rendering resolution, which is then upsampled to the specified Display Resolution. Very effective for trading image sharpness for GPU performance.

Description_VideoQuality.name:
Select a quality preset.
This option changes to custom when another option was manually changed.

Description_InputDevice.name: Select the preferred audio input device.

Description_OutputDevice.name: Select the preferred audio output device.

Description_ScopeMultiplierSensitivity.name: Sensitivity override per individual optic magnification.

Description_NotificationFilterFortunaPas.name: Show Fortuna Pass notifications in the HUD. You can check these in the Notification Log.

Description_NotificationFilterFriendInvi.name: Show Friend Invite notifications in the HUD.

Description_NotificationFilterFriendStat.name: Show Friend Status notifications in the HUD.

Description_NotificationFilterWorkbench.name: Show Gear Printer notifications in the HUD. You can check these in the Notification Log.

Description_NotificationFilterPlayerQuar.name: Show Player Quarter notifications in the HUD. You can check these in the Notification Log.

Description_NotificationFilterSquadInvit.name: Show Squad Invite notifications in the HUD.

Description_NotificationFilterSquadUpdat.name: Show Squad Status notifications in the HUD.

Description_ShowFPS.name: Shows an fps counter in the HUD.

Description_AntiAliasingQuality.name: Smoothens edges and colors to make them appear less jagged and more appealing.

Description_MouseSmoothing.name: Smooths down the movement for mice that do not have a high DPI.

Description_ScopedSensitivity.name: The sensitivity that is used when aiming down sights.

Description_ADSSensitivity.name: The sensitivity that is used when aiming down the sights without an optic offering a magnification. Example: Iron sights.

Description_UnfocusedWindowVolume.name: The volume multiplier used when the game window is not in focus

Description_EnableGPUCrashDebug.name: To enable further debugging which can help track down crashes that are being experienced.

Description_PushToTalk.name: Turn push to talk on or off. The allocated key can be adjusted in keybinds.

Description_ColorblindIntensity.name: Use the slider to adjust the intensity of the chosen colorblind mode.

Description_ColorblindType.name: Using the image below, switch between <BH1>Protanopia, Deuteranopia, and Tritanopia colorblind</> modes until you can see as clearly as possible the most numbers. This changes the color of all screen elements.

Shop_FounderPacks.description:
Thank you for playing The Cycle! 

If you would like to support the development of the game you can purchase one of our Founder's Packs!

Each Founders Pack immediately unlocks exclusive costumes and weapon skins, and contains in-game currency at a one-time discount. In-game currency can be used later this year in our in-game shop.

This incredible offer is only available for a limited time and will be removed when The Cycle officially launches. 

The purchase of a Founder's Pack happens via the Epic Games Store - clicking on the purchase button will redirect you to our store page.

Station_Insurance_Purchase_Tooltip.name:
Insured items can either be salvaged or return a percentage of their base purchase value in the case you fail to evac.

Insured items that are dropped prior to death or picked up by squadmates are not compensated. If an item is marked to be salvaged but is looted by another player, you will receive a compensation in K-Marks.

Gear Salvage will compensate item attachments, but only if they remained on the insured item before being retrieved.

Quitting a match early will result in insurance being voided and no compensation given.

Station_Insurance_ClaimsVary_Tooltip.name: Insured items that are dropped prior to death or stolen by squadmates are not compensated. If an item is marked to be salvaged but is stolen by another player, you will receive a compensation in K-Marks.

Station_RetentionBonus_SeasonStartInfo.name: Thank you for joining us for Season 2 of The Cycle: Frontier! While every prospector starts the new season fresh, your Aurum and cosmetic items have been carried over and can be used immediately. And if you purchased a bundle in the past, check your Delivery Station to retrieve your items. Now, enjoy Fortuna III, and be sure to check out the new Fortuna Pass!

Station_CareerPage_MissionText.name: This is a Mission Description. The House that produces the most Spice will control Dune.

Station_OnboardingOverlay_Appearance_Pop.name:
This is the APPEARANCE screen.

Here you can alter your appearance by choosing between various base prospector types and costume options for each.

You can also select a banner, choose which emote to use, and which foam pose your rivals will perform when you defeat them.

Appearance items can be unlocked through Shop purchases or granted by levelling up through the Fortuna Pass.

Note that appearance changes have no effect on gameplay.

Station_OnboardingOverlay_Factions_Popup.name:
This is the FACTIONS screen.

Factions control Prospect Station and hire prospectors to complete Jobs on the surface.

You can choose to work for any of the three factions at the start of a match, with your standing increasing based on your final match position. Improve your standing with to unlock access to blueprints for weapons, suits, abilities, and more.

Here you can see your progress with each faction and what their next standing levels will grant you.

Station_OnboardingOverlay_Seasons_PopupB.name:
This is the FORTUNA PASS screen.

The Fortuna Pass allows you to get exclusive rewards by completing challenges and earning XP to level up throughout the season.

Gold Access access will reward you with even more items as you progress through the season.

Here you can track active challenges and your season progress.

Station_OnboardingOverlay_InventoryDetai.name:
This is the ITEM DETAILS screen.

Here you can see information on the selected item, as well as customize it with mods or vanity.

Items can be obtained from the different faction markets if you have enough standing and can pay the Krypto Marks licensing cost.

Items must be equipped to your loadout in order to be purchasable in-match through the Gear Store.

Station_OnboardingOverlay_InventoryMods_.name:
This is the MODS screen

Mods can be applied to weapons and suits to alter their behavior. Each mod is unique to that item, even if a similar mod exists for another item.

Here you'll be able to purchase and equip item mods, as well as see the effects they will have.

Station_OnboardingOverlay_Inventory_Popu.name:
This is the PRINTING screen.

Your items are printed using blueprints, which are granted to you by the various factions and require specific materials, collected during matches or from match rewards.

Here you can print items from your blueprints, check the requirements needed for printing, and head to item details to modify your printed items.

Station_OnboardingOverlay_Shop_PopupBody.name:
This is the SHOP

Here you can purchase new appearance items like weapon vanity, emotes, or costumes to customize your appearance, as well as Gold Access for the Fortuna Pass to begin unlocking even more exclusive content by completing various challenges.

The currency used in the shop is Aurum; Aurum can be acquired with real-money purchases in the shop, with Founder's Packs, or by progressing through the Fortuna Pass.

Station_OnboardingOverlay_GearSet_PopupB.name:
This is your LOADOUT

Each match you start with only your suit, a secondary weapon, and your wits. Your suit affects your health and movement abilities, such as access to a jetpack or rapid dodging.

The Gear Store Supplies section lists the selection of items items you'll have available for purchase during a match using in-match currency.

Station_OnboardingOverlay_Launch_PopupBo.name:
Welcome to Prospect Station!

This is the PLAY screen. From here you can select which game mode to queue for and play.

Training Matches allow for playing a match with no other players; while they do not grant rewards, they are good for training. The Shooting Range allows for quickly testing your loadout, as well as try out any weapon or ability.

The Tutorial, Training Match, and Shooting can be launched while matchmaking; you will be pulled into the match when a game is found.

Tips_Quest_PowerUp_02.name: Be careful, some facilities will deploy old guard droids while being powered up, and they probably won't be friendly.

Tips_Quest_Mushrooms_01.name: Brightcap Mushrooms are valuable, so collect them if you see them. Be careful, you're not the only one that wants them.

Tips_ContractLicenses_01.name: Contract licenses are a great way to earn Krypto Marks.

Tips_Misc_03.name: Establishing a comm link allows you to communicate over radio with other Prospectors.

Tips_Misc_02.name: Fortuna III's ecosystem is heavily affected by the energy field known as The Cycle. The storms caused by surges in The Cycle will aggravate the planet's fauna, so be careful and make sure to gear up.

Tips_Quest_LaserDrill_02.name: Korolev laser drills generate large amounts of precious metals as it drills for letium.

Tips_Quest_Minerals_02.name: Mineral drills project a locator beacon when their work is complete to help you relocate them. Unfortunately your rivals can see it too.

Tips_Quest_Minerals_01.name: Mining minerals creates noise and attracts aggressive creatures. Larger mineral deposits will draw in more creatures, and Prospectors.

Tips_Quest_Uplink_01.name: Once you are synced with an Uplink it will reveal locations of both objectives and other players on your map.

Tips_Misc_04.name: Remember to gear up before you drop down to the surface. You'll want to be able to defend yourself on Fortuna III.

Tips_Misc_01.name: The Cycle is a deadly energy field surrounding Fortuna III with a cyclical decline and surge. Your time window on the surface is short, make it count.

Tips_Quest_LaserDrill_01.name: The Korolev laser drill can be used as an alternative way to get back to Prospect Station.

Tips_Quest_Boss_02.name: The Warden Alpha can be summoned by placing a bait at its feeding grounds.

Tips_Quest_Boss_01.name: The Warden Alpha is a tough beast, and it always brings angry friends along.

Tips_Quest_Trophy_01.name: The zeal shard's radiation signature is visible to all Prospectors, be careful.

Tips_Quest_PowerUp_01.name: When powering up a station be wary of other Prospectors trying to claim the main generator for themselves.

Tips_MetaProgression_01.name: Work for factions and gain their recognition. They will give you access to their tech in return.

OsirisStationIdleC_09.name:
Brightcap soup? Are these people serious? They're making soup out of them now?

I turned down a position at Astra-Cirrus for this...

OsirisStationIdleC_04.name: *cough* Maintenance was just here last week, what is wrong with these air filters?

KorolevStationIdleC_06.name: *groan* Another Letium platform exploded in atmosphere, why do these things happen to /me/!

KorolevStationIdleC_09.name: *sigh* Three hundred years investing in automation and I still have to write these reports myself.

BFCStationFTUEOpenStash07.name: A Mineral Scanner will help you find valuable ores, a must have for any real prospector.

VanityShopFirstGreeting_01.name: A new customer! Have a look around, I've got something for everyone!

ICAStationIdleC_06.name: A quarter million still missing... You know we still send search parties every week?

BFCStationFTUEOpenStash05.name: A quick grenade throw or emergency health stim could make all the difference.

BFCTutorialFindNewWeapon02.name: Ah, I was wondering what happened to the last guy... Check if they left anything you can use.

KorolevNewContracts_05.name: Ah, Prospector, we have new Jobs just for you!

OsirisStationIdleC_07.name: Ah, Prospector; I'm sure that by now you've been in a few storm surges... Be sure to inform me if you start to experience any vivid Déjà vus.

KorolevFirstGreeting_01.name: Ah, a new Prospector come to work with Korolev?

KorolevStationIdleC_03.name: Ah, another accident in Viktor's crew, and another week-long sick leave. Like clockwork.

BFCStationFTUEFirstMatch02b.name: Ah, back in the day the planet was a paradise, with the factions all vying for its natural wealth and resources... Now it's down to prospectors like you to grab what's left behind.

ICAGreeting_04.name: Ah, good to see you, Prospector.

OsirisContractAccepted_02.name: Ah, good, I need that done soon.

KorolevGreeting_03.name: Ah, it is my favorite prospector again!

OsirisContractClaimed_04.name: Ah, just in time. Thanks, Prospector.

ICAContractClaimed_02.name: Ah, thank you, great job Prospector!

ICAItemPurchased_01.name: Ah, that was made right here!

BFCStationFTUEMissionsICA01.name: Ah, the Independent Civilian Advisory... their job is to keep the station and everyone on it alive, so yours is to get them whatever they ask for.

KorolevFactionRankUp_05.name: Ah, what is the term, 'rank up'?

OsirisContractAccepted_05.name: Ah, yes, we do need that done, Prospector.

KorolevItemPurchased_02.name: Ah, you have a good eye!

KorolevContractClaimed_03.name: Aha, I knew you'd get that done of course.

KorolevFactionRankUp_03.name: Aha, you're climbing the ranks, Prospector!

Female01Player1IMATracking_03.name: Alien Tracks here, let's follow them

Male01Player1IMATracking_03.name: Alien Tracks here, let's follow them

VanityShopGreeting_05.name: All my stock is authentic, guaranteed.

BFCTutorialEvacPath03EvacWarn.name: All right, a ship's on the way. Careful not to be under it when it lands, it would NOT end well for you, trust me...

OsirisContractAccepted_03.name: All right, assinging that work to you.

BFCStationFTUECrafting01.name: All right, good job handling that. Come back to the bar, there's a few more things you should learn.

BFCTutorialStartEvac01.name: All right, you've got something worth bringing back to the station. Let's look into getting you off the planet.

BFCStationFTUEOpenStash01.name: All that free gear won't help if it's not equipped; open your inventory to check your loadout.

Female01Player1IMABoss_03.name: Alpha Crusher, let's hunt it down

Male01Player1IMABoss_03.name: Alpha Crusher, let's hunt it down

Female01Player1IMABoss_04.name: An Alpha kill would make a good tale, let's go

Male01Player1IMABoss_04.name: An Alpha kill would make a good tale, let's go

OsirisStationIdleC_02.name: An entire H.C-5 covered in Pure Veltecite, and all those Korolev imbeciles can think to do with it is burn it for fuel!

Female01Player1IMAPowerUp_03.name: An old facility, let's get it powered up again

Male01Player1IMAPowerUp_03.name: An old facility, let's get it powered up again

BFCGameIntro_11.name: And of course there’re the hunters, preying on other prospectors and taking their haul.

OsirisFirstGreeting_01.name: Another Prospector? Good, Osiris always needs more people in the field.

ICAStationIdleC_07.name: Another departure off the books from bay 4. Those Osiris creeps are keeping stuff from us, I know it.

KorolevStationIdleC_08.name: Another radiation alert at the refinery, stupid sensitive equipment.

Female01Player1IMABoss_02.name: Anyone up for taking down an Alpha Crusher?

Male01Player1IMABoss_02.name: Anyone up for taking down an Alpha Crusher?

ICAGreeting_03.name: Anything we can help you with?

VanityShopGreeting_01.name: Anything you need, I got it.

BFCTutorialIntro03.name: As a Prospector, you'll spend your days scavenging through Fortuna III's old colony sites for resources, retrieve exotic samples, or just shoot up some aliens.

BFCFirstMatchTalk1.name: Barking out simple commands won't cut it for every encounter, you might have to hash out deals with nearby rivals, or give detailed orders to allies.

BFCStationFTUELaunch01.name: Before you head down, you may want to Insure your Loadout; you won't get the full value back, but it beats losing everything if you get knocked down on the surface.

Female01Player1IMABrightcaps_03.name: Brightcaps in the area, pick 'em up

Male01Player1IMABrightcaps_03.name: Brightcaps in the area, pick 'em up

BFCTutorialKillAI02.name: Careful with these guys; their hides are soft, but they pack a mean bite, and there's never just one.

ICAContractAccepted_03.name: Careful, last prospector failed that one...

ICAStationIdleC_10.name: Cedar Team picked up another group yesterday... couldn't even speak, practically feral...

OsirisNewItems_01.name: Check our shop, you might see something new.

KorolevNewContracts_02.name: Check out our Jobs, we have something new for you.

KorolevNewItems_02.name: Check out our shop, we have something new!

BFCStationFTUEFactionShop.name: Check the faction's Market; they sell better gear than the Quick Shop, but you'll have to increase your reputation for access to their very best.

ICANewItems_02.name: Check the shop, we have something new!

ICANewContracts_04.name: Come check the new Jobs, Prospector!

Female01Player1IMAPowerUp_04.name: Come on, I need this facility powered up

Male01Player1IMAPowerUp_04.name: Come on, I need this facility powered up

Female01Player1IMAUplink_05.name: Come on, I need to fill this Data Drive

Male01Player1IMAUplink_05.name: Come on, I need to fill this Data Drive

Male01Player1IMAMeteor_05.name: Come on, I wan to check out that meteor impact

Female01Player1IMAMeteor_05.name: Come on, I want to check out that meteor impact

Male01Player1IMATracking_04.name: Come on, let's do some Tracking

Female01Player1IMABrightcaps_04.name: Come on, let's get some Brightcaps

Male01Player1IMABrightcaps_04.name: Come on, let's get some Brightcaps

Female01Player1IMATracking_04.name: Come one, let's do some Tracking

Female01Player1IMAUplink_04.name: Could still be good -research- data at the Uplink

Male01Player1IMAUplink_04.name: Could still be good -research- data at the Uplink

Female01Player1IMATracking_02.name: Creature Tracks here, could lead to something good

Male01Player1IMATracking_02.name: Creature Tracks here, could lead to something good

Male01Player1IMADeaddrop_02.name: Dead Drop here, give me a minute

BFCGameIntro_01.name: Decades ago we settled on Fortuna III, and for a while this frontier world was paradise.

KorolevStationIdleC_02.name: Did you know it's illegal to import live Earth animals into the station? Well now we both know.

ICAStationIdleC_05.name: Don't worry if you can taste the air, the techs say the filters are working perfectly.

Female01Player1IMAPowerUp_01.name: Facility here, could power it up

Male01Player1IMAPowerUp_01.name: Facility here, could power it up

ICAStationIdleC_04.name: Federal Authority is asking for more surface scans... three decades, and now they start caring?

BFCTutorialEvacPath01.name: Getting off Fortuna III is simple in theory: head to an Evac zone, call down a ship, hop on when it lands, and you're done.

BFCStationFTUELivedFailed.name: Glad to see you back, but you still have work to do. Check your gear and head back to the surface.

BFCStationFTUECrafting04.name: Go ahead and make yourself a new bag.

Female01Player1IMAUplink_03.name: Gonna check the Uplink, watch my back

Male01Player1IMAUplink_03.name: Gonna check the Uplink, watch my back

BFCStationFTUEFirstMatch03a.name: Good work! Now it's time to head for an evac and call down a ship; check your map.

BFCStationFTUEFirstMatch03.name:
Good work! Now it's time to head for an evac and call down a ship; check your map.

If you don't get off the planet, your gear and backpack won't either, so make smart use of your Safe Pockets...

OsirisFactionRankUp_04.name: Good work, Prospector; I'll update your rank now.

OsirisContractClaimed_05.name: Good, I'll, mark that as 'completed', then.

ICAContractAccepted_01.name: Good, we really need that done!

BFCStationFTUEOpenStash03.name: Good. You don't want to go down there unarmed. Pick a weapon to equip.

VanityShopNewItems_04.name: Got a moment? Might have something new for you...

BFCStationFTUELivedSucceeded.name: Great job down there! Now that you've completed a mission, head to the right faction and Claim your reward.

ICAFactionRankUp_04.name: Great work, Prospector! Enjoy your new ICA status!

ICAStationIdleC_09.name: Great, The Fortunates are planning /another/ coup. They really won't be happy until we just crash the damn station onto the surface, will they?

BFCStationFTUEQuarters01.name: Great; that'll make it easier to carry more loot before you evac. Now, come and see me again, I have a little surprise for you.

ICAStationIdleC_03.name: Habitat's raising prices on water again. I'll have to remind them who really runs this station.

ICAStationIdleC_02.name: Happy to see you're still with us! Too many run back to the safety of the Artery systems after their first drop...

OsirisNewItems_04.name: Have a look at the shop, Prospector, you should see something new.

BFCStationFTUEQuarters04.name: Have a look into upgrading your Quarters. It takes effort, but it's worth it.

VanityShopNewItems_02.name: Have a look, I've got something new just for you!

ICANewItems_04.name: Have a look, Prospector, we have new items in the shop!

KorolevNewItems_05.name: Have you checked our shop? We have new items!

KorolevStationIdleC_05.name: Have you considered recording your excursions? I think there could be money in that...

Female01Player1IMAMeteor_02.name: Head to the meteor impact, might be something good

Male01Player1IMAMeteor_02.name: Head to the meteor impact, might be something good

Female01Player1IMAHunt_03.name: Heard Crushers fetch a great bounty...

Male01Player1IMAHunt_03.name: Heard Crushers fetch a great bounty...

VanityShopStationIdleC_05.name: Heard Prospectors get their own Aurum Generator these days. You checked yours?

BFCStationIdleC_11.name: Heard another guy got lost in those caverns. Went in alone, never left.

BFCStationIdleC_01.name: Heard there's a new squad around, making a real mess of things on the surface. You be careful, all right?

BFCStationFTUECrafting02.name: Here are a few materials and some K-Marks for a job well done. Now, put them to use over at the Public Gear Printer.

BFCTutorialThreat01.name: Here's the rub: rule of law doesn't apply down there, and it's not just the local creatures that'll be after you.

BFCStationFTUEAlt02.name:
Here's the rub: rule of law doesn't apply down there, and it's not just the local creatures that'll be after you.

Competition among prospectors is fierce, and most don't make it back to the station on their own two feet. If you get taken out, your suit will keep you and whatever's in your Safe Pockets in one piece, ready for rescue. But your gear and bag? That'll belong to someone else.

Come and see me once you're done down there, we should talk.

ICANewContracts_01.name: Hey, Prospector! Have you seen the new Jobs?

SeasonPassRankIncrease_01.name: Hey, good job out there, Prospector!

VanityShopBye_01.name: Hey, you be careful down there, all right?

BFCStationFTUEMissionsOsiris02.name: High tech is their game, Top of the Line. Overspecialized and fiddly, if you ask me...

Female01Player1IMADeaddrop_05.name: Hold on, I've got to drop something here

Male01Player1IMADeaddrop_05.name: Hold on, I've got to drop something here

OsirisContractAccepted_01.name: Hrm, yes, you should be able to handle that.

OsirisStationIdleC_08.name: Hrmm, another spike in atmospheric Letium. It's like something is releasing massive amounts in one big surface explosion...

OsirisStationIdleC_01.name: Hrmm, we should have seen frequency drift by now...  Strauss, have Sat-Ops schedule another calibration test for number 36.

ICAStationIdleC_01.name: I doubt any of these prospectors could even tell quartz from diamond.

OsirisContractClaimed_03.name: I had full confidence in you, of course.

OsirisItemPurchased_01.name: I hope you know how to use that.

ICAContractAccepted_05.name: I look forward to marking it complete!

VanityShopStationIdleC_09.name: I need a bigger stockroom, keep running out of storage space...

Female01Player1IMATracking_01.name: I see some alien Tracks, let's follow

Male01Player1IMATracking_01.name: I see some alien Tracks, let's follow

OsirisStationIdleC_06.name: I still can't believe those half-wits running Korolev tried to sell Strider meat as food... At least the medical reports were informative.

BFCStationIdleC_09.name: I told the techs about number twelve. What a mess that made, eugh.

VanityShopStationIdleC_01.name: I used to be a Prospector like you. Then I saw an Alpha Crusher for the first time. No thank you.

KorolevContractAccepted_04.name: I was hoping someone would get that done.

BFCStationFTUELaunch02.name:
I'll cover you for your first few drops, but try to make it back on your own, will you?

And remember to put the good loot in your Safe Pockets, it'll help offset any bad runs.

SeasonPassBye_05.name: I'll have new challenges ready soon.

Female01Player1IMAHunt_01.name: I'm after one of those big Crusher fellas

Male01Player1IMAHunt_01.name: I'm after one of those big Crusher fellas

Female01Player1IMAMinerals_03.name: I'm checking for minerals, cover me

Male01Player1IMAMinerals_03.name: I'm checking for minerals, cover me

Female01Player1IMABoss_05.name: I'm going after the Alpha, you coming?

Male01Player1IMABoss_05.name: I'm going after the Alpha, you coming?

Female01Player1IMAUplink_01.name: I've got a Data Drive here

Male01Player1IMAUplink_01.name: I've got a Data Drive here

Female01Player1IMADeaddrop_03.name: I've got a Dead Drop here, watch my back

Male01Player1IMADeaddrop_03.name: I've got a Dead Drop here, watch my back

SeasonPassGreeting_04.name: I've got a bit of everything here.

VanityShopNewItems_03.name: I've got a few new things I'm sure you'll like!

VanityShopNewItems_05.name: I've got new inventory, check it out before it's gone!

BFCGameIntro_07.name: I've seen all types try their luck on the surface...

BFCTutorialFindCrate.name: I've set up a container with some goodies nearby; go check it out.

BFCStationFTUEMissionsICA02.name: ICA gear's almost all designed and built on the station, point of pride here. It's good stuff, well rounded.

BFCStationFTUEFirstMatch03b.name: If you don't get off the planet, your gear and backpack won't either, so make smart use of your Safe Pockets...

BFCTutorialThreat02.name: If you get taken out, your suit will keep you and whatever's in your Safe Pockets in one piece, ready for rescue. But your gear and bag? That'll belong to someone else.

BFCStationFTUEQuarters06.name: If you help upgrade the station, the station helps you back. Supply Crates will get you ammo, stims, guns,... Whatever a Prospector might need.

BFCStationFTUEFactionShopSell.name: If you've got too much in your stash, you can always just sell some loot for K-Marks and faction rep. But always keep some gear with you; a gun beats a fistful of K-Marks in a fight, every time.

Female01Player1IMAMeteor_04.name: Impact site nearby, we should head there

Male01Player1IMAMeteor_04.name: Impact site nearby, we should head there

BFCTutorialEvacPath02.name: In practice, that ship willl attract unwanted attention; always keep an eye out for rival prospectors.

BFCGameIntro_13.name: In the end, anything goes in the hunt for fame and fortune.

KorolevNewContracts_04.name: Interested in more work? We have new Jobs!

SeasonPassNewSeason_03.name: Interested in something new? Check out the new season!

BFCStationFTUETalkToBadum01.name: Is that a new face on Prospect Station? Come over to my bar and I'll show you the ropes.

KorolevGreeting_05.name: It is good to see you again, Prospector!

KorolevContractAccepted_05.name: It's as good as done, eh Prospector?

BFCGameIntro_05.name: It's where we trade, arm ourselves, gear up for the next drop. It's home.

Female01Player1IMAHunt_02.name: Join me on a Crusher hunt

Male01Player1IMAHunt_02.name: Join me on a Crusher hunt

OsirisFactionRankUp_02.name: Keep up the good work, Prospector.

BFCStationFTUEMissionsKorolev01.name: Korolev are the industry guys, they keep the station powered and the factories running. They put jobs out for raw materials and old machinery.

BFCStationIdleC_06.name: Korolev's on another recruitment drive, won't be satisfied until the whole station's wearing orange.

VanityShopBye_03.name: Leaving already? Don't be a stranger!

Female01Player1IMAMeteor_01.name: Let's check out the impact site

Male01Player1IMABoss_01.name: Let's go take on an Alpha

Male01Player1Loot_03.name: Let's have a look around here

Male01Player1IMAMinerals_04.name: Looks like a mineral deposit, let's check it out

BFCStationFTUEFirstMatch04a.name: Looks like you made it back in one piece! Not everyone survives their first encounter with Fortuna III.

BFCStationFTUEFirstMatch04.name:
Looks like you made it back in one piece! Not everyone survives their first encounter with Fortuna III.

Now, go check with whichever faction sent you out and claim your contract's rewards.

BFCTutorialHealthStim01.name: Looks like you're wounded. Try using a Stim to heal up.

BFCGameIntro_10.name: Many drop as a crew, sharing the loot, never leaving anyone behind.

Female01Player1IMAMeteor_06.name: Meteor hit the area, let's check it out

Male01Player1IMAMeteor_03.name: Meteor hit the area, let's check it out

Male01Player1IMAMinerals_02.name: Mineral deposit, let's have a look

VanityShopStationIdleC_03.name: Most of this stuff's made in-system. We're not exactly on any shipping lanes here...

BFCGameIntro_06.name:
My name’s Badum, I run things up here.
So, you wanna be a Prospector?

Female01Player1Evac_02.name: Need to get off this rock!

Male01Player1Evac_02.name: Need to get off this rock!

Female01Player1IMADeaddrop_01.name: Need to stash something, cover me

Male01Player1IMADeaddrop_01.name: Need to stash something, cover me

KorolevNewItems_04.name: New items available for -to- purchase, Prospector.

OsirisNewItems_03.name: New items available for you, Prospector.

SeasonPassNewSeason_01.name: New season started, lots on offer!

ICAContractClaimed_05.name: Nice, enjoy the rewards and come back soon!

BFCStationFTUEDiedSucceeded.name: Not every run ends the way you want it to, but it looks like you still got things done! Now head to the right faction and Claim your reward.

BFCTutorialScanner.name: Now let's see you try some actual prospecting. Equip your Scanner and look around for minerals

BFCStationFTUEOpenStash04.name: Now remember to take some ammo. Make sure it fits the gun you choose; light, medium, shotgun... you get the idea.

BFCStationFTUETalkToBadum03.name: Now, Fortuna III's real beautiful, but it's also real damn deadly. You'll need some gear before dropping down if you plan to survive. I'll get you started with some spares, but be careful; whatever you lose down there, you're not getting back!

BFCStationFTUETalkToBadum03B.name: Now, Fortuna III's real beautiful, but it's also real damn deadly. You'll need some gear before dropping down if you plan to survive. I'll get you started with some spares, but be careful; whatever you lose down there, you're not getting back!

BFCStationFTUEFirstMatch04b.name: Now, go check with whichever faction sent you out and claim your Jobs rewards.

BFCStationCharCustom01.name: Now, let's get a good look at you...

BFCStationFTUECharacter.name: Now, let's get a good look at you...

BFCStationFTUELaunch03.name: Now, off you go, have fun!

BFCStationFTUEFirstMatch01.name: OK, you're all set. Head to the Launch Terminal. From there you can start your first drop onto Fortuna III.

OsirisStationIdleC_03.name: Oh great, another contaminated sample. How hard can it be to not get rattler spit on everything?

BFCTutorialFindNewWeapon03.name: Oh, that'll come in handy! Try it out, and don't forget to grab some ammo for it.

KorolevFactionRankUp_04.name: Oho, making a name for yourself, eh?

BFCStationFTUEFirstMatch02c.name: Old settlements and abandoned factories will be the best places to find anything valuable. Remember to put the real good stuff in your Safe Pockets, it'll stick with you even if you're taken out.

BFCStationFTUEMissions02.name: Once your name's on the work roster I'll set you up with some gear.

VanityShopItemPurchased_04.name: Ooh, that was hard to come by!

BFCTutorialStartEvac02.name: Open your map to find available Evac points.

BFCStationFTUEMissionsOsiris01.name: Osiris are only here to research all the weird stuff on the surface. They'll have you hunting down alien beasts one day, and picking pretty flowers the next.

KorolevStationIdleC_07.name: Osiris could be running the station with all the Veltecite they collect, but they just... sit on it?

BFCStationIdleC_04.name: Osiris really should stop sending researchers down to the surface, ends bad every time.

BFCGameIntro_09.name: Others are more the furtive sort, using stealth and caution to beat the odds.

BFCTutorialInventory02.name: Pay attention to your Safe Pockets. When on the real Fortuna, whatever you put in there, you bring back home, even if you don't make it back in one piece.

BFCStationFTUESafetyPockets.name: Pay attention to your Safety Pockets. Anything there you keep, even when you fail to evac.

BFCStationIdleC_02.name: Planet's changed in the last few years, just gets nastier and nastier.

BFCStationFTUEQuarters02.name: Prospect Station provides its namesake heroes with their own private quarters; I called in a favor and got you a place early, right next door, too.

KorolevNewContracts_01.name: Prospector! We have new Jobs available.

OsirisStationIdleC_05.name: Prospector, I've heard reports of active CoTEC colony drones on the surface; make sure to let me know if you find any.

OsirisNewContracts_03.name: Prospector, Osiris is offering new Jobs.

OsirisNewContracts_02.name: Prospector, check out our new Jobs.

VanityShopNewItems_01.name: Prospector, come check my new stuff!

KorolevStationIdleC_10.name: Prospector, have you considered a steady position at our weapons plant? A lot of positions just opened up!

SeasonPassNewSeason_04.name: Prospector, see what's new this season!

ICANewContracts_05.name: Prospector, the ICA has more work for you! Check the new Jobs.

KorolevNewItems_03.name: Prospector, we have something new just for you!

BFCTutorialInventory01.name: Prospectors need to know how to organize their bag; always know what you've got on you and what you can carry.

KorolevItemPurchased_05.name: Put it to good use, OK?

ICAStationIdleC_08.name:
Reject it. Yeah, missing customs declaration or whatever.

Ah, the simple pleasures are the best.

BFCStationIdleC_03.name: Remember to check abandoned luggage, you never know what the old colonists left behind.

VanityShopBye_02.name: Remember to tell your friends about our Daily Offers!

VanityShopBye_04.name: Remember to tell your friends about our great offers!

ICABye_08.name: Remember, the ICA is always here for you!

ICABye_04.name: Remember, the ICA is always here for you.

BFCFirstMatchCommsWheel.name: Remember, you're not the only prospector down there; communication's an important skill, especially with all the itchy trigger fingers around.

KorolevStationIdleC_04.name: Returned to sender? Two years in transit and /now/ they notice missing declaration?!

BFCStationIdleC_10.name: Rumour is the Authority's sending a fleet over for a surprise inspection. No wonder the ICA's on edge lately.

VanityShopStationIdleC_10.name: See anything you like, just let me know.

BFCStationFTUEOpenStash06.name: Shields are a necessity, unless you're one of those crazy scavengers that drop down near naked.

KorolevStationIdleC_01.name: Six years, six years. Just six more years 'till retirement

BFCGameIntro_12.name: Skill might keep you alive, but you’ll need more than that to thrive on Fortuna III.

BFCStationFTUEAlt01.name:
So you made it to the surface on your own; eager one, aren't you?

Seeing as you skipped orientation day, you might need some pointers. You're now officially a Prospector; someone brave, desperate, or crazy enough to scavenge through Fortuna III's overrun colony sites for resources, retrieve exotic samples, or just shoot up some aliens. Whatever the factions pay you to do, really. Oh, and then evac off the surface, that's an important step.

SeasonPassFirstGreeting_01.name: So, here to prove yourself as a Real Prospector?

SeasonPassFirstGreeting_02.name: So, here to prove yourself as a Real Prospector?

BFCStationFTUEFirstMatch02a.name: So, you made it to the surface!

BFCStationFTUEFirstMatch02.name:
So, you made it to the surface! 

Ah, back in the day the planet was a paradise, with the factions all vying for its natural wealth and resources... Now it's down to prospectors like you to grab what's left behind.

Old settlements and abandoned factories will be the best places to find anything valuable. Remember to put the real good stuff in your Safe Pockets, it'll stick with you even if you're taken out.

BFCStationFTUETalkToBadum02.name:
So, you want to be a prospector?

Well first thing's first, head to any of the faction HQs and pick up a Job; that'll get you your name on the work roster and your first task on the surface. Don't worry about which faction to start with, you can take jobs from any of them at any time later on.

Come back when you've got a Contract and I'll get you started with some spare gear.

BFCStationFTUEMissions01.name: So, you want to be a prospector? Well first things first: head to the Faction HQs, they'll give you some work to do.

BFCStationFTUEStart.name: So, you're the new arrival? Come over to my bar and I'll show you the ropes.

BFCGameIntro_08.name: Some are relentless, stopping at nothing and risking it all.

BFCStationIdleC_08.name: Some joker keeps calling down an evac and never gets on. There'll be hell to pay... once I figure out who they are.

VanityShopStationIdleC_06.name: Sounds like there's another Leafman infestation on this level. At least they're cute...

OsirisStationIdleC_10.name: Strauss, for god's sake /stop/ forwarding reports about the Progenitor ruins humming back to HQ ! Do you /want/ them to shut us down?!

VanityShopStationIdleC_07.name: Suit tech has sure improved; used to be the Cycle would knock you out in /seconds/.

BFCTutorialFindNewWeapon01.name: Take some time to look around for anything useful, you never know what you might find lying around.

ICAContractAccepted_02.name: That one? I'll mark you down for it then!

KorolevContractAccepted_01.name: That should be easy for you!

OsirisItemPurchased_02.name: That was under priced, I assure you.

BFCStationFTUEOver.name: That's about all I can do for you kid. Now go make a name for yourself!

ICANewContracts_02.name: The ICA could really use your help with these new Jobs, Prospector.

OsirisContractAccepted_04.name: The rewards for that should be worth your while.

BFCStationFTUEMissionsKorolev02.name: Their gear's nothing fancy, but it always works, and packs a punch.

BFCGameIntro_03.name: Then one day the planet turned on us, with freak storms forcing us to evacuate the colony.

KorolevNewContracts_03.name: There are new Jobs for you, Prospector.

OsirisNewContracts_05.name: There are new Osiris Jobs, Prospector.

BFCTutorialKillAI01.name: There should be some Striders in the area, go take 'em out.

VanityShopStationIdleC_08.name: There're still colonists down on the planet, you know? Can't imagine how they've survived...

Female01Player1IMADeaddrop_04.name: There's a Dead Drop here, cover me

Male01Player1IMADeaddrop_04.name: There's a Dead Drop here, cover me

OsirisNewContracts_04.name: There's new work to do, Prospector; check for new Jobs.

SeasonPassGreeting_05.name: These rewards are only for the best prospectors.

SeasonPassGreeting_07.name: These rewards are only for the best prospectors.

SeasonPassGreeting_08.name: These rewards are only for the best prospectors.

BFCStationFTUEDied01.name:
Things didn't go your way, huh? Your suit does a good job of keeping you intact and safe for retrieval, but your loot and gear's as good as lost.

Remember to use your Safe Pockets to store valuables, and Insuring your Loadout will dampen the blow on your wallet when things go south.

BFCStationFTUEDiedFailed.name: Things didn't go your way, huh? Your suit'll protect you and your safe pockets, but everything else is lost. Get some new gear, and try again!

BFCStationFTUEQuarters07.name: This is where you can pick up your Supply Crates, as well as any salvage and insurance packages.

BFCTutorialIntro02.name: This sim will let you get acquainted with the surface, risk free.

BFCTutorialMinerals.name: Time for some honest, hard work. Use your pickaxe to crack that rock open and check for minerals.

BFCTutorialEvacShipLeft.name: Told ya. Call it again, it won't come back on its own.

VanityShopGreeting_04.name: Trying out for a new look?

VanityShopGreeting_06.name: Trying out for a new look?

BFCStationFTUEQuarters08.name: Upgrade your Generators, and you'll even get some Aurum and K-Marks! Bit of a reward for keeping this place running.

Female01Player1IMAUplink_02.name: Uplinks are risky, could use a hand

Male01Player1IMAUplink_02.name: Uplinks are risky, could use a hand

Female01Player1IMAHunt_05.name: Want some action? Let's hunt a Crusher

Male01Player1IMAHunt_05.name: Want some action? Let's hunt a Crusher

Female01Player1EnemyNear_03.name: Watch it, prospector in the area

Male01Player1EnemyNear_03.name: Watch it, prospector in the area

ICANewContracts_03.name: We have a few new Jobs for you, Prospector.

OsirisNewItems_05.name: We have new items available for you, Prospector.

KorolevNewItems_01.name: We have new items for you, Prospector!

OsirisNewContracts_01.name: We have some new Jobs for you, Prospector.

ICANewItems_01.name: We have some new items just for you, Prospector!

ICANewItems_05.name: We have something new in the shop, have a look!

SeasonPassNewSeason_02.name: We just kicked off a new season, check the rewards!

ICAItemPurchased_03.name: We make no profit from this, I assure you!. Well, aside from fees and taxes...

BFCGameIntro_02.name: We mined its vast resources in the shadow of ancient ruins.

SeasonPassNewSeason_05.name: We've got a new season running, come have a look!

Female01Player1UnderAttackSquad_04.name: We've got a rival squad on us!

Male01Player1UnderAttackSquad_04.name: We've got a rival squad on us!

ICANewItems_03.name: We've updated our inventory, come check our shop!

OsirisNewItems_02.name: We've updated our shop, Prospector. Have a look.

BFCTutorialIntro01.name: Welcome to Fortuna III! Well, a decent simulation of it, anyways.

BFCGameIntro_14.name:
Welcome to The Frontier,
I think you’ll fit in here just fine.

ICAFirstGreeting_01.name: Welcome to the ICA! Working with us keeps this station going!

BFCTutorialIntro04.name: Whatever the factions pay you to do, really. Oh, and then evac off the surface, that's an important step.

BFCGameIntro_04.name: With the Surface lost, we set up base on Prospect Station, orbiting the deadly planet.

ICAFactionRankUp_05.name: Working for the ICA benefits everyone, including you!

BFCStationFTUEInsurance02.name: You can also pay to mark an item for salvage retrieval. If you die, you'll get the item back after a while... so long as nobody else looted it.

BFCStationFTUECrafting05.name: You can always put in for a rush job. It's not free, but your time isn't, either!

KorolevContractAccepted_03.name: You can handle that, I'm sure.

BFCStationFTUECrafting03.name: You can print more advanced gear there. It'll make your life as a prospector a whole lot easier, trust me.

BFCStationFTUEQuarters03.name: You can thank me later, just keep the factions happy, and stay out of trouble! Well, enough chit-chat, go check out your new home!

VanityShopStationIdleC_04.name: You ever been to Vastos? It's just like our Fortuna... minus the Cycle and monsters and all that.

BFCStationIdleC_07.name: You ever ride a gravbike? Those things have real power, I tell you.

Female01Player1NeedWeapon_05.name: You got a gun for me?

Male01Player1NeedWeapon_05.name: You got a gun for me?

BFCStationIdleC_05.name: You know, for a while we tried to keep things pretty civil down there, had rules and scores and everything... it didn't work out.

BFCStationFTUEInsurance01.name: You may want to Insure some of your gear; you won't get the full value back, but it beats nothing if you get knocked out.

ICAItemPurchased_04.name: You put that to good use, OK?

BFCStationFTUEInsurance03.name: You should have some tokens to cover your first few drops, but try to make it back on your own, all right?

BFCStationFTUEMissions03.name: You'll need some gear before dropping down if you plan to survive. I'll get you started with some spares, come back to the bar.

BFCStationFTUEFirstMatchStorm.name: You'll need to be extra careful if you're still down there when a Cycle storm kicks up; no pilot's going to risk flying their evac ship through that hell just for you.

BFCTutorialEvacPath03.name: You'll need to be extra careful if you're still down there when a Cycle storm kicks up; no pilot's going to risk flying their evac ship through that hell just for you.

BFCTutorialHealthStim02.name: You'll want to carry Consumable items like that in your Bag, they'll improve your chances down there.

ICAFactionRankUp_02.name: You're really making a name for yourself here!

OsirisFactionRankUp_01.name: You've been doing good work, Prospector.

OsirisFactionRankUp_05.name: You've done good work for Osiris... thanks.

KorolevFactionRankUp_01.name: You've done great work for Korolev!

ICAFactionRankUp_01.name: You've done great work for the people, Prospector!

BFCStationFTUEOpenStash02.name: Your Safe Pockets won't be able to carry all your loot; equip a backpack.

BFCStationFTUEOpenStash08.name: Your head makes for a pretty target down there, so don't forget a helmet.

SeasonPassRankIncrease_03.name: Your ranking's increased, keep at it!

BFCTutorialEvacPath04.name: Your ride's here. It'll leave without you, so you best get in quick!

ICAFactionRankUp_03.name: Your work for the ICA hasn't gone unnoticed!

TOOL_AdvancedMineralScanner.description: A more advanced version of Korolev's mineral scanning device that is able to detect any form of valuable minerals.
TOOL_AdvancedMineralScanner.name: Advanced Mineral Scanner

TOOL_Binocular_Basic_01.name: Binocular
TOOL_Binocular_Basic_01.description: Used to look at things at a distance

TOOL_MineralScanner_01.description: A highly versatile scanning device that is only able to detect Nickel by default, but can be modded to detect any Minerals on Fortuna.
TOOL_MineralScanner_01.name: Mineral Scanner

TOOL_Mining_01.description: An experimental automatic Mining tool designed by Korolev to allow for more efficient extraction of Minerals from Fortuna III.
TOOL_Mining_01.name: Heavy Mining Tool

TOOL_Pickaxe_01.description: A Prospector's trusty pickaxe, used to tear valuable minerals from veins and deposits on Fortuna III.
TOOL_Pickaxe_01.name: Pickaxe

TOOL_FlareGun_01.lore: Flares are easy to create in the future.
TOOL_FlareGun_01.name: Flare Gun

TOOL_MessaggePost_01.lore: Message Post are easy to create in the future.
TOOL_MessaggePost_01.name: MessagePost

TOOL_Stormbrella_01.lore: Those lightning strikes can be deadly...
TOOL_Stormbrella_01.name: Stormbrella
TOOL_Stormbrella_01.description: When active attracts and protects from Lightning strikes during the Storm

WP_G_AR_Energy_01.description: A burst rifle shooting accurate controlled 3-shot bursts, effective against most threats a Prospector might encounter.
WP_G_AR_Energy_01.lore: After the success of the Adaptive Phase Pistol, Osiris thought to develop a weapon platform of more interest to the military market. While this new powered-up weapon can handle significantly more energy than its smaller cousin, Osiris has yet to solve the problem of overheating in full-auto firing mode, or the high risk of carrier-shield leakage when in charged mode.
WP_G_AR_Energy_01.name: Phasic Lancer

WP_D_BR_Shard_01.description: A capable marksman rifle boasting a decent fire rate, accuracy, and handling.
WP_D_BR_Shard_01.lore: Building upon the the ICA's own Shattergun, this battle rifle is tuned to discharge the crystaline shards it uses as ammunition in a more controlled and accurate burst.
WP_D_BR_Shard_01.name: Lacerator

WP_E_SMG_Bullet_01.description: A commonly used SMG with high rate of fire which makes it formidable up close.
WP_E_SMG_Bullet_01.name: S-576 PDW
WP_E_SMG_Bullet_01.lore: The CoTEC S-576 is one of the standard firearms used aboard Federation ships, stations, and outposts. Lightweight, compact, and produced in mass by various manufacturers, this model is a staple in practically every weapons market. This model doesn't look quite right, but it still gets the job done.

WP_E_AR_Energy_01.description: A decent fully automatic rifle, doesn't excel in any one department, but comfortably versatile and lethally effective.
WP_E_AR_Energy_01.name: AR-55 Autorifle
WP_E_AR_Energy_01.lore: The AR-55 Phase Autorifle was commissioned by the IFA in an attempt to improve standard Authority armament without further increasing their reliance on Korolev Heavy Industries. While the IFA would eventually settle with the SAR-62, CoTEC's AR-55 remains a popular weapon in private armies and corporate security forces, and has succeeded at being an effective market counter to the popular KOR-47.

WP_D_AR_Bullet_01.description: A dependable assault rifle offering a good balance between accuracy and rate of fire.
WP_D_AR_Bullet_01.name: Advocate
WP_D_AR_Bullet_01.lore: Based on the SAR-62 carbine used by the Federation itself, the ICA 'Advocate' has only a few deviations from the original design, meant to allow for its manufacture in environments of relative scarcity.

WP_G_Pistol_Energy_01.description: A dependable pistol, fires controlled and powerful three-shot bursts.
WP_G_Pistol_Energy_01.name: Scarab
WP_G_Pistol_Energy_01.lore: The Scarab, an Adaptive Phase Pistol, is one of Osiris' most successful weapons, able to induce a localized rapid matter state change on remote targets at a fraction of the energy cost of more conventional laser-based weaponry. With energy efficiency and safety in mind, the Scarab is a solid choice of sidearm, though its compact form limits the extent of its lethality.

WP_D_LMG_Energy_01.description: A fast firing Phase LMG perfect to suppress targets.
WP_D_LMG_Energy_01.name: ICA Guarantee
WP_D_LMG_Energy_01.lore: This Fortuna III custom isn't known for its finesse, but it'll chew through any target if the user manages keep it under control. With the amount of ammo expended, you're Guaranteed to hit something!

WP_G_AR_Needle_01.description: A flechette assault rifle, it's heavy hitting but less accurate compared to other rifles.
WP_G_AR_Needle_01.lore: Intended for use in pressurised environments, the Manticore was designed for more militaristic use than the compact ASP. Lightweight, accurate, and lethal, it's seen use by marines both performing as and defending against boarding parties.
WP_G_AR_Needle_01.name: Manticore

WP_D_Sniper_Gauss_01.description: A gauss sniper rifle firing metal rods at immense velocity. This weapon is favored among Prospectors that want to resolve their differences quickly and from a safe distance.
WP_D_Sniper_Gauss_01.name: Kinetic Arbiter
WP_D_Sniper_Gauss_01.lore: One of The ICA's most advanced conventional weapons, the Kinetic Arbiter is little more than a military-grade gauss gun stripped down to its most basic components needed to function, without any of the the fancy fittings or safety mechanisms.

WP_G_HVY_Beam_01_Event_01.description:
A less powerful version of the Zeus, mass produced just in time for the holidays.

Called Zeus for turning any mortal into the God of Lightning, this heavy weapon will fulminate any creature that meets your jolly ire.
WP_G_HVY_Beam_01_Event_01.name: Holiday Zeus Beam
WP_G_HVY_Beam_01_Event_01.lore: NOTE: This item will only be available during the holidays!

WP_A_BR_Bullet_01.description: A marksman rifle with good accuracy and power excels in medium range engagements.
WP_A_BR_Bullet_01.name: KBR Longshot
WP_A_BR_Bullet_01.lore: The predecessor to the KOR-47, the Longshot was developed for the Federation to serve as a long range support weapon for ground troops. Designed with a low unit cost in mind, Korolev opted to ensure high accuracy and power over developing a fully automatic weapon.

WP_G_Sniper_Energy_01.description: A phase tech marksman rifle; considered ahead of its time, the impacts are powerful for its class, and it boasts a high rate of fire.
WP_G_Sniper_Energy_01.name: Basilisk
WP_G_Sniper_Energy_01.lore: The result of an offshoot project during early development of the Phasic Lancer, the Basilisk trades higher ammo count for a much stronger energy discharge. While still in the prototyping, Osiris is happy to offer this rifle to Prospectors of a high enough standing.

WP_G_AR_Beam_01.description: A powerful beam rifle that requires charging up before firing. Not the easiest to handle, but lethal in proper hands.
WP_G_AR_Beam_01.name: Gorgon
WP_G_AR_Beam_01.lore: The Zeus' little sister, the Gorgon may not be as devastating, but its glare can leave any target petrified in place. And crispy.

WP_A_SMG_Shard_01.description: A rapid-firing shard SMG, a good choice for taking out targets at close range, though of little use in long range engagements.
WP_A_SMG_Shard_01.lore: Faced with an ever-increasing surplus of adrentite sludge, an inventive Korolev waste management engineer brought forth a novel way of handling the hazardous byproduct: shoot it. The 'Scrapper' was the first viable weapon produced by Korolev Munitions, one of the megacorp's many competing arms manufacturing branches, and the first known to use adrentite crystals as ammunition.
WP_A_SMG_Shard_01.name: KM-9 'Scrapper'

WP_E_AR_Energy_01_Scrappy.description: A rusty automatic rifle, doesn't seem to excel anymore.
WP_E_AR_Energy_01_Scrappy.name: Rusty AR-55 Autorifle

WP_E_SMG_Bullet_01_Scrappy.description: A rusty used SMG with high rate of fire that still has some worth in close range engagements.
WP_E_SMG_Bullet_01_Scrappy.name: Rusty S-576 PDW

WP_A_SGun_Energy_01.description: A semi-automatic shotgun, it's heavy and a poor choice at range, but utterly devastating up close.
WP_A_SGun_Energy_01.lore: Korolev's first attempt at a building a phase weapon, the Phase-Kinetic Reactive Maelstrom's ammo pack carries more than enough energy to fulminate whatever gets in its way in a matter of seconds, provided it's close enough.
WP_A_SGun_Energy_01.name: PKR Maelstrom

WP_D_HVY_Exotic_01.description: A slow firing launcher, projectiles create a harming energy field on impact. Further discharges of the launcher into an active field feed into it, until reaching a critical point resulting in a devastating release of energy.
WP_D_HVY_Exotic_01.lore: Discovered while developing an a veltecite-powered plasma cannon, High Amplitude Zender Emmissions were found to have an effect remarkably similar to the effect of the energy field known as The Cycle, though the decaying plasma core fueling it is much shorter lived than the anomaly surrounding Fortuna III.
WP_D_HVY_Exotic_01.name: HAZE

Launcher_Epsilon_Grenade02.description: A standard grenade launcher with a high damage output, it requires skilled use to operate efficiently.
Launcher_Epsilon_Grenade02.name: FF4 Detonator
Launcher_Epsilon_Grenade02.lore: Initially intended for use by colonists to clear out vermin en masse, the Detonator's payload has been modified for larger and more dangerous targets.

WP_E_Launch_Nade_01.description: A standard grenade launcher with a high damage output, it requires skilled use to operate efficiently.
WP_E_Launch_Nade_01.name: FF4 Detonator
WP_E_Launch_Nade_01.lore: Initially intended for use by colonists to clear out vermin en masse, the Detonator's payload has been modified for larger and more dangerous targets. This one seems to be from even before the colony was founded.

WP_E_Pistol_Bullet_01.description: A standard semi-automatic pistol. It's an effective sidearm for any Prospector.
WP_E_Pistol_Bullet_01.name: K-28
WP_E_Pistol_Bullet_01.lore: With a design that's seen no change in over two centuries, the CoTEC K-28 is one of the most popular weapons throughout known space, as are its many knock offs.

Ammo_Medium.description: Ammo commonly used for assault rifles and light machine guns.
Ammo_Medium.name: Medium ammo

Ammo_Light.description: Ammo commonly used for pistols and submachine guns.
Ammo_Light.name: Light ammo

Ammo_Heavy.description: Ammo commonly used for sniper and designated marksman rifles.
Ammo_Heavy.name: Heavy ammo

WP_D_SMG_Energy_01.description: An SMG offering high versatility in its effective range.
WP_D_SMG_Energy_01.lore: Using parts built on Prospect station with material from the surface combined with salvaged components from power tools meant to build starships, the ICA's Brute more than lives up to its name.
WP_D_SMG_Energy_01.name: Voltaic Brute

WP_E_Pistol_Bullet_01_Scrappy.description: An old rusty semi-automatic pistol. Its glory days are over.
WP_E_Pistol_Bullet_01_Scrappy.name: Rusty K-28

WP_D_SGun_Shard_01.description: An unconventional shotgun shooting crystal fragments through kinetic and thermal energy.
WP_D_SGun_Shard_01.lore: Crafted on Prospect station using salvage and wood from the planet itself, this scattergun demonstrates The ICA's ingenuity and ability to thrive with limited resources. A molded adrentite crystal, byproduct of its refinement for use as rocket fuel, serves as both projectile and propellant; a small electric charge incites a rearrangement in the crystal's lattice, with the sudden energy release fracturing the crystal into thin shards along its length as they're shot through the barrel.
WP_D_SGun_Shard_01.name: Shattergun

WP_E_Sniper_Bullet_01.lore: Anachronistic by design, this CoTEC bolt action rifle was meant for civilian use in frontier planets to manage hostile wildlife. Effective in its purpose, the massive increase in wildlife hostility and numbers lead to mass production of lower grade rifles like this one.
WP_E_Sniper_Bullet_01.description: Bolt action sniper rifle that was commonly used by the local population.
WP_E_Sniper_Bullet_01.name: C-32 Bolt Action

WP_G_SMG_Needle_01.name: Asp Flechette Gun
WP_G_SMG_Needle_01.lore: Intended for use by law enforcement in pressurized environments, this weapons' flechettes provide lethal stopping power, can easily defeat light armor, and are designed to prevent overpenetration; a risk in any environment, but disastrous on ships and stations.
WP_G_SMG_Needle_01.description: Lightweight SMG. A formidable automatic weapon for close range encounters.

WP_E_SGun_Bullet_01.name: B9 Trenchgun
WP_E_SGun_Bullet_01.description: Pump-action shotgun, high-spread, short range. Yep, it's a shotgun, all right.

WP_A_Pistol_Bullet_01.lore: Based on their ubiquitous rivet guns, also known as 'energy hammers', the 'Hammer' was an attempt at developing a low cost personal defense weapon. Popular among those wanting a dependable high-powered pistol, its weight and complex operation make it unattractive to the mass market.
WP_A_Pistol_Bullet_01.name: Hammer
WP_A_Pistol_Bullet_01.description: Pistol, inflicts devastating damage on its targets, at the cost of any kind of subtlety.

WP_D_Pistol_Bullet_01.name: Bulldog
WP_D_Pistol_Bullet_01.description: Shotgun that suffers from very limited range.
WP_D_Pistol_Bullet_01.lore: Simple and effective, compact firearms utilizing shotgun shells are popular on stations as close range problem solvers for their high damage as well as for mitigating the risk of overpenetration that more conventional pistols carry. The Bulldog is the ICA's prefered design, easy to build and maintain, and even easier to operate.

WP_G_HVY_Beam_01.description: Called Zeus for turning any mortal into the God of Lightning, this heavy weapon will fulminate any creature that meets your divine ire.
WP_G_HVY_Beam_01.lore: While beam based weapons have found heavy use on warships for centuries, only in recent years has technology allowed for a portable form factor. These weapons use a linked-light beam to contain and focus a jet of plasma accross great distances, with a fairly predictable effect on whatever it contacts.
WP_G_HVY_Beam_01.name: Zeus Beam

WP_A_AR_Bullet_01.description: Heavy assault rifle. Lower firing rate than most competing weapons in its class but packs a punch.
WP_A_AR_Bullet_01.name: KOR-47
WP_A_AR_Bullet_01.lore: The KOR Bullpup Automatic Rifle 2247, more commonly known as the KOR-47, is Korolev Heavy Industries' signature weapon and a mainstay of many national and private armed forces.

WP_D_Pistol_Bullet_01_Event_01.name: Holiday Bulldog
WP_D_Pistol_Bullet_01_Event_01.lore: NOTE: This item will only be available during the holidays!
WP_D_Pistol_Bullet_01_Event_01.description:
Not quite a snowball launcher, unless you ever played with Kevin and his iceballs.

While very very mean at close range, in its default configuration it suffers from very limited range.

WP_Shared_Scrappy.description: It has outlived it's glory days.

WP_A_HVY_Shell_01.name: KARLA
WP_A_HVY_Shell_01.lore: The Korolev Anti-material Repeating Light Artillery, or KARLA, was originally intended as a vehicle-mounted weapon, but advanced recoil management allowed Korolev to produce a portable version for use without a warsuit.
WP_A_HVY_Shell_01.description: While able to neutralize heavily armored targets, the KARLA howitzer is unwieldy and suffers from a low rate of fire.

WP_A_Sniper_Gauss_01.name: KARMA-1
WP_A_Sniper_Gauss_01.lore: The Korolev Advanced Recursive Magnetic Artillery, first prototype, is a miniaturization of the sort of weaponry more commonly found on warships, offered exclusively to the Prospectors for early testing. While no longer powerful enough to take down a spacecraft, it's more than enough to handle the threats of Fortuna III.
WP_A_Sniper_Gauss_01.description: While heavy and requiring a charge-up to fire, a direct hit from the KARMA-1 will cripple if not outright kill any target.

WP_A_Launch_MSL_01.name: KOMRAD
WP_A_Launch_MSL_01.lore: Short for Korolev Ozone-powered Micro Rocket Assault Device, the KOMRAD is one of the most destructive weapon systems developed by the megacorp, and one of its most expensive.
WP_A_Launch_MSL_01.description: This fearsome weapon platform is capable of firing salvos of fast-moving missiles capable of making short work of any hostile element.

WP_E_SGun_Bullet_01_Scrappy.name: Rusty B9 Trenchgun
WP_E_SGun_Bullet_01_Scrappy.description: Rusty Pump-action shotgun, high-spread, short range. Just a bit damaged.
